instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Th1H sesor read SMC error
threads.message:
Hello Everybody

Working on liquid damaged <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Late 2014. before come to me some ones clean board and replaced LCD connector and replaced bios , (I m not sure where liquid damaged)

Computer turns on and working but too slow and fan noise ;

When i checked by ASD

[I][12/31/13 16:25:49]     Temperature (Th1H) -- Fin Stack (test #11) - Extended Sensor Flat Line Test
        - Checks that the Sensor changes value i.e. not stuck, with longer time allowance for change (5 mins).
[16:25:49]     ERROR - -13005 [The SMC can not read this sensor] -- TEST FAILED
[12/31/13 16:26:10]     Fan Motor: Exhaust (test #4) - Turn On Automatically
        - System turns on fan motor and verifies fan motor can reach minimum/maximum values
[16:26:53]     ERROR -- 9 [Motor unable to stabilize between min and max limits] -- TEST FAILED
[12/31/13 16:26:53]     Quick Fan motor Test (test #5) - Quick Fan motor Test
        - System verifies that the fan motor is running to target speed
[16:27:12]     ERROR -- 7 [Fan motor is spinning slower than it should] -- TEST FAILED
[12/31/13 16:27:12]     Fan Motor: Exhaust (test #21) - Verify Max Speed Other Fans At Full, Min Speed All at Min
        - Verify fan max speed with other fans at full speed, min speed with other fans at minimum speed
[16:27:57]     ERROR -- 9 [Motor unable to stabilize between min and max limits] -- TEST FAILED[/I]


What was tested:

I/O board
I/O Flex cable
Fan
Trackpad and cable ( cable also damaged)

After some flux + heat SMC fan noise gone but machine working slow and same error at ASD, checked <RESISTOR>R5210</RESISTOR> and <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_ALERT_L</SIGNAL> no short to ground .

Is it looking like SMC problem or can i check any thing?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Th1H sesor read SMC error
threads.message:
Th1h is on the LIO board. If that and the flat cable were already replaced it can only be a few things. J9500 pin 3 and 5 carry the data so connector can be bad. <RESISTOR>R5370</RESISTOR>/71 can be bad or there is still crap under the SMC.
Measure on diode mode on pin 3 and 5 of J9500 to see if traces are not open.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Th1H sesor read SMC error
threads.message:
Thank for suggestion Duke.

Problem is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> voltage surge after replacement <CHIP>U8010</CHIP> every things ok problem solved.
